qas.question: What is one defining characteristic of the Gothic architectural style?
Which type of architecture first used the pointed arch during the seventh century?
What other type of architecture also made use of the pointed arch?
The Roman Karamagara Bridge is an example of what type of structure?
Parabolic and pointed arches were used in what type of constrcution?
What is the only defining characteristic of the Gothic architectural style?
Which type of architecture first used the pointed arch during the fifth century?
What other type of architecture also made use of the curved arch?
What type of construction involved many twisted arches?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>The pointed arch<b5_0/><a0_0/>, one of the defining attributes of Gothic, was earlier incorporated into <a1_0><b6_0>Islamic architecture<b6_0/><a1_0/> following the Islamic conquests of Roman Syria and the Sassanid Empire in the Seventh Century. The pointed arch and its precursors had been employed in Late Roman and <a2_0><b7_0>Sassanian architecture<b7_0/><a2_0/>; within the Roman context, evidenced in early church building in Syria and occasional <a3_0>secular structures<a3_0/>, like the Roman Karamagara Bridge; in Sassanid architecture, in the parabolic and pointed arches employed in <a4_0><b8_0>palace and sacred construction<b8_0/><a4_0/>.
